com.gamelanlabs.chimple2.solvers

Class MetropolisHastingsSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gamelanlabs.chimple2.solvers.Solver
      • com.gamelanlabs.chimple2.solvers.MetropolisHastingsSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Query
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatlabMetropolisHastingsSolver

    public class MetropolisHastingsSolver
extends Solver
    (Correct) traceMH solver. This class is very well documented, so see the comments for algorithm details.
    Author:
    BenL

      boolean verbose_tracemh_steps
      Print messages on each traceMH step describing which monkey was resampled, what the energy & penalized energy of the proposal cage is, what the last energy was, what the acceptance ratio is, and whether this proposal was accepted or rejected.

    • Field Detail

      • verbose_tracemh_steps

        public boolean verbose_tracemh_steps
        Print messages on each traceMH step describing which monkey was resampled, what the energy & penalized energy of the proposal cage is, what the last energy was, what the acceptance ratio is, and whether this proposal was accepted or rejected.

      • temperature

        public double temperature
        The temperature is set by some subclasses. It controls how much the solver is willing to "float around" looking for solutions (and not strictly descend the energy gradient). Final sampling should always be done at temperature=1.0 to ensure the correct posterior distribution (unless you only care about the modes).

    • Constructor Detail

        Parameters:
        p - ChimpleProgram whose posterior will be sampled
        a - Arguments to the program
        cf - Cost function

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public void solve(int burnin,
         int samples,
         int spacing)
        Solve using traceMH.
        Parameters:
        burnin - Number of "burn-in" samples to throw away initially. These won't be recorded in results[].
        samples - Number of samples.
        spacing - Number of samples to throw away between saved samples.

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Description copied from class: Solver
        The solver is invoked by calling this method. This abstract class requires that all subclasses must implement a no-argument version (ie. with default values for burnin, samples, etc.), but generally a with-arguments version will be called.
        Specified by:
        solve in class Solver
